channel.title: Mobile Phone Parts
channel.description:
In front of you lies a mobile phone which works perfectly however the ribbon cable between some buttons/screen and the main board has snapped. Replacing it would be too expensive, so: What do I do?!?
[img]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=402798.0;attach=17053;image[/img]

item.title: Mobile Phone Parts
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

I’m not too sure but is this what your talking about?

http://www.eoem.cc/buy,1835-Samsung+J600+flex+cable.html
http://cgi.ebay.com.my/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?ViewItem&item=150367603854

Read full topic

item.title: Mobile Phone Parts
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Elijah:

It depends on the model, if it’s a popular model samsung, you could just buy the replacement cable and do it yourself. Or you could buy one that has other damage to it(ie. cracked screen). And get the cable from that.

Its a J600 (Should have mentioned in OP). It is semi-popular but I honestly think I could just buy one second hand and it would be more worth it.
Another thing I forgot to mention is that it defiantly will not have life as a “proper” mobile phone anymore: I basically ripped it apart- although the main board seems to work. (READ IT COWS ARE SCARED)

Are there any other uses?

Read full topic
